newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK DEPOS, FORWARDS, BONDS HOLD, ECU/DRS IDLES.
newsitem.headline: GREEK DEPOS, FORWARDS, BONDS HOLD, ECU/DRS IDLES.

text.p: Greek depos were steady but for a drop in the overnight rate and forex forwards were holding morning levels, bonds were idling and ecu/drachma was trading in narrow ranges, dealers said.

"It is very quiet and forex forwards along with depos are holding early levels unaffected by the central bank's move to leave more funds in the market," said a dealer at a foreign bank. "It was only the overnight rate that eased after the announcement."
There have been some offers in one- and two-week tenors in forex forwards from abroad, the dealer said.
Bank of Greece drained 100 billion drachmas of 14-day funds at 11.90 percent in its regular depo tender on Wednesday leaving a net amount of about 150 billion drachmas in the system.
Bonds were also unmoved by the injection of more liquidity into the market with prices little changed, dealers said.

"The market shrugged off the central bank's move with bond prices basically unchanged," said a bond dealer. "More than 300 billion drachmas will be drained tomorrow and the market does take this lightly."
Greece auctioned 100 billion drachmas of 10-year, 8.80 percent fixed coupon bonds on Tuesday. It was Greece's first ever issue of 10-year drachma-denominated bonds.
It also re-opened bids for three-year, 9.8 percent bonds, five-year, 9.2 percent bonds and seven-year, 8.9 percent bonds. Fifty billion drachmas for each maturity are auctioned.
The cut-off prices were set at 100.1, 99.25, 98.77, 98.61 for the three-, five-, seven- and 10-year fixed coupon bonds respectively, the central bank said.
The mark was quoted at 158.23/33 from Wednesday's 158.315 fix, the dollar at 273.29/39 drachmas from 273.000 and the ecu at 309.35/45 from 309.310 drachmas.
"Ecu/drachma is locked in tight ranges," said a forex dealer. "The high for the day was 309.40 but it has eased a bit to 309.24/29 in late quiet trading."
